business.headline: Budget 2026: Will tax reforms and clearer rules revive India's crypto market?With the Union Budget 2026 around the corner, the virtual digital asset sector is hoping for changes that can ease taxation and provide regulatory certainty. Experts believe this could reignite growth in India's crypto ecosystem.

Wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December as prices firm upFood prices showed mixed trends during the month. Wholesale food inflation remained flat in December, compared with a sharp 2.6% decline recorded in November.

Sensex ends 245 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; TCS down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 244.98 points to close at 83,382.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 66.70 points to end at 25,665.60.

US targets Iran trading partners with 25% tariff: Will India be impacted?Markets in India have turned cautious as investors assess whether stricter US penalties on countries trading with Iran could have a spillover impact on Indian exporters, oil trade and overall market sentiment.

When can you withdraw 100% of your PF money? EPFO rules explainedWithdrawing your provident fund money has often felt complicated for many employees. Recent changes by EPFO now clearly explain when members can withdraw their full PF balance.

Will Budget 2026 simplify tax rules for investors?As policymakers prepare Budget 2026, tax experts and investors are hoping for tax changes that make savings and investments simpler, fairer and more predictable.

HIP, TIP before SIP: Experts take on smart financial planningMany investors focus on SIPs to build wealth, but experts say protection should come first. Health and term insurance can safeguard savings and ensure long-term financial plans stay on track during emergencies.

Affordable housing is shrinking in India. Can Budget 2026 fix the problem?Industry experts warn that India is heading towards a divided housing market. Can Budget 2026 bridge the growing gap between luxury and affordable homes?

Budget 2026: Will healthcare get better access and patient-first reforms?With Budget 2026 around the corner, healthcare stakeholders are calling for reforms that put patients first. Better access, affordable treatment and stronger preventive care remain top priorities for the sector.

Kotak Mahindra stock split: Did private lender's shares really crash 80% today?At first glance, the share fall caused concern among investors tracking the stock. However, the sharp fall was not due to any problem in the bank's business or financial health.

Housing demand falls after 2 years. Is it an opportunity for homebuyers?For homebuyers planning a purchase, this phase offers more options, steadier prices, and room to negotiate, but choosing the right location and builder matters more than chasing short-term discounts.

Vedanta share price jumps 6%: Why is the stock rising today?The rally was driven by a combination of positive brokerage commentary, renewed focus on the company's proposed demerger, and firm momentum in the metals and mining space.

Gold and silver prices continue to rally: Buy now or wait for a dip?With gold and silver near record highs, investors face a choice between chasing momentum or waiting for pullbacks. Price levels, support zones, and timing will decide near-term returns for portfolios.

NPS, PF withdrawal rule changes: What you can take out and whenNPS and EPF withdrawal rules have changed, affecting how much money can be accessed and when. From early exits to emergency withdrawals, here is what subscribers should check now.
Muted start on Dalal Street as benchmark indices drift lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was up marginally by 15.58 points to 83,643.27, while the NSE Nifty50 added 7.95 points to 25,740.25 as of 9:23 am.

BCCL IPO allotment today: What listing gains can investors expect?BCCL IPO: The public listing opened for subscription on January 9, 2026, and closed on January 13, 2026. Shares are scheduled to list on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.

BCCL IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date, and GMPBharat Coking Coal IPO saw extraordinary demand across all investor categories by the time bidding closed on January 13, 2026. BCCL IPO was subscribed 143.85 times overall.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Khan drops 18 kg ahead of Happy Patel, credits anti-inflammatory diet Aamir Khan discussed his significant weight loss and the effects of an anti-inflammatory diet ahead of his cameo in Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos. The film is set for release on January 16, 2026.

Mohanlal announces release date of Drishyam 3, teases 'past never stays silent' Mohanlal's Drishyam 3 is set for a global release on April 2, coinciding with Maundy Thursday. Mohanlal made the announcement on social media.

Badshah meets Yogi Adityanath before Gorakhpur show, praises his compassion Rapper-singer Badshah shares reflections after meeting Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath in Gorakhpur, highlighting the leader's calm and compassionate nature ahead of his performance at the closing ceremony of the Gorakhpur Mahotsav.

Who was Hussain Ustara? The razor-wielder who 'inspired' Shahid Kapoor's O' Romeo Hussain Ustara, known to be a contract killer in Mumbai, features in Vishal Bhardwaj's O' Romeo. His family has filed a defamation suit raising questions about how the film portrays him.

Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor's dance to dhol beats at friend's reception goes viral A video of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor dancing to dhol beats at a friend's reception at Gauri Khan's restaurant in Mumbai has gone viral, as the couple briefly stepped away from their current film projects to join the celebration.

Rahu Ketu: Kantara scream, drug-snorting scenes cut; censors issue U/A certificate Pulkit Samrat and Varun Sharma's 'Rahu Ketu' is set to release in theatres on January 16. Ahead of its release, the censor boardrd has suggested a few cuts, including the removal of the 'Kantara' scream.

Allu Arjun, Lokesh Kanagaraj announce new film, shoot begins this year Lokesh Kanagaraj announced his next film starring Allu Arjun with a viral Pongal–Makar Sankranti promo. Produced by Mythri Movie Makers, the untitled project marks AA23 and LK7, with Anirudh Ravichander composing the music.

Nupur Sanon says sister Kriti convinced mother about interfaith wedding to Stebin Nupur Sanon opened up about her interfaith marriage to Stebin Ben. She revealed that her elder sister Kriti Sanon helped in convincing their mother about Stebin.


, Stebin Ben open up on their interfaith wedding; Kriti Sanon helped convince their mother

Ram Charan makes dosas as Konidela family marks Bhogi, Allu Arjun skips The Konidela family came together at Chiranjeevi's home in Hyderabad for Bhogi celebrations on Wednesday. While Allu Arjun is away in Japan for a film release, he skipped the annual family tradition.

Parasakthi's Sivakarthikeyan calls Vijay his brother: Jana Nayagan will release soon Parasakthi actor Sivakarthikeyan referred to Vijay as his brother in an interview during Pongal celebrations in Delhi. The actor also commented on the viral social media war between his and Vijay's fans on social media.

Abhishek Malhan dismisses fake chat rumours, asks fans to value authenticity Abhishek Malhan recently responded to viral fake chat screenshots circulating on social media and addressed ongoing rumours about his personal life. He urged fans to respect his boundaries.

Scott Adams (1957–2026): The Dilbert creator who mapped corporate absurdity Scott Adams, creator of Dilbert, highlighted corporate workplace absurdities through satire. His controversial views sparked backlash, but his legacy as a cultural critic remains significant.

Aamir Khan all set for Rajkumar Hirani's Dadasaheb Phalke biopic. Shoot details out Aamir Khan and Rajkumar Hirani are set to start filming their biopic on Dadasaheb Phalke. The project has not been put on a burner as rumours suggested earlier.

Celina Jaitly says estranged husband blocks access to children: They're brainwashed Celina Jaitly has spoken about her ongoing custody dispute with her estranged husband, Peter Haag, stating she has been unable to communicate with her three sons, despite an Austrian court order granting joint custody. The actor alleged interference, financial difficulties, and challenges in securing her rights since returning to India.

Anaganaga Okka Raju review: A breezy rural comedy driven by clean humourRelease Date:Wed Jan 14, 2026 Anaganaga Okka Raju film review: This Naveen Polishetty-Meenakshi Chaudhary starrer Sankranthi release is a typical rural comedy drama that is familiar, funny, emotional and engaging.

Vaa Vaathiyaar review: Karthi shines but film doesn't match its quirky promiseRelease Date:Wed Jan 14, 2026 Vaa Vaathiyaar movie review: Director Nalan Kumarasamy's Vaa Vaathiyaar, starring Karthi, Sathyaraj and Krithi Shetty, is a quirky comedy that doubles up as a superhero drama. While the film presents a unique concept, it didn't explore its full potential.

JioStar's Alok Jain on KKK, Bigg Boss: Want to create formats that can go global JioStar's Alok Jain confirmed 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' returns this year after the IPL (Indian Premiere League), while explaining the decision to merge 'Bigg Boss' into a single, screen-agnostic format. He also emphasised the vision to develop homegrown Indian IPs that can eventually achieve global success.

Sussanne Khan's late birthday wish for Hrithik Roshan features sons, Saba. Video Sussanne Khan shared a heartfelt video collage a few days after Hrithik Roshan's birthday, to wish the star. The video featured their sons, besides Hrithik's partner Saba Azad and Sussanne's partner Arsalan.

Hrithik Roshan's Kaabil 2 in the works; Sanjay Gupta promises a deadlier sequel Sanjay Gupta confirmed the sequel to his 2017 action-thriller 'Kaabil' in response to a social media post. The movie featured Hrithik Roshan and Yami Gautam in pivotal characters.

general news.headline: Bishnoi gang operating in Canada on behalf of Indian govt: Canadian police reportCanada's national police service has said that the Lawrence Bishnoi gang was operating in the country on behalf of the Indian government. The assessment, in a report seen by Global News, added that despite being designated a terrorist organisation, the gang continued to expand its footprint in Canada.

Need Greenland for golden dome: Trump's renewed push ahead of Vance's key meetTrump's outreach to Nato came hours before Vice President JD Vance was set to meet Danish and Greenlandic officials in Washington to discuss the future of Greenland.

Zubeen Garg was very drunk, had declined life jacket: Singapore cops to courtSingapore police told a coroner's court that singer Zubeen Garg drowned off Lazarus Island last September after entering the water without a life jacket while severely intoxicated, with investigators ruling out foul play.

2nd ODI Live: Mitchell, Young fifties keep Kiwis in huntIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ), 2nd ODI Live score: New Zealand (134 for 2 in 28 overs). Daryl Mitchell and Will Young have helped the Black Caps recover in the run-chase with a handy partnership in Rajkot.

Stalin stirs the Pongal pot: Is the festival Tamil, Dravidian or national?By branding Pongal as a "Dravidian festival", Chief Minister M K Stalin has turned a centuries-old harvest celebration into a political statement ahead of the 2026 polls, reopening a familiar debate in Tamil Nadu over culture, identity and where regional pride ends and national tradition begins.

Iran protester, 26, to be executed today, family got just 10 minutes for final meetErfan Soltani, a 26-year-old Iranian, is set to be executed in public today, in Iran's first death sentence linked to the anti-Khamenei protests, which entered its 20th day on Wednesday. The Khamenei regime moved fast from his "trial" to the execution stage. Soltani's family got just 10 minutes to say goodbye to him.

What changed after Blinkit dropped 10-minute promise? We spoke to delivery boysHandcrafted ByOur Editors A silent strike on New Year's Eve forced quick commerce giants to drop their flashy 10-minute delivery promises within days. What brought the change and has the race against time really slowed down for delivery agents?

End of the Raider: How Mahmud Ghazni's empire went up in flamesMahmud Ghazni plundered India for 24 years, sacking temples like Somnath. His empire crumbled after his death, ending in flames. It was poetic justice for his brutal raids.

India Today Group launches Tak 360, country's first FAST news channelAnchored in the philosophy of 'gali se globe tak', Tak 360 integrates hyperlocal reporting with national and global perspectives, offering a seamless and comprehensive news experience.

Leave Iran: India's advisory to citizens amid deadly unrest, US attack UpdatesThe advisory, dated January 14, urges Indians to exercise due caution, avoid areas of protests or demonstrations, remain in contact with the Embassy, and keep travel and identity documents readily available. In another advisory, the Ministry of External Affairs urged Indians to avoid any travel to Iran until further notice.
PSLV-C62 lost in space: Here's what Isro does when a rocket failsAn internal Failure Analysis Committee (FAC) will dissect telemetry data, focusing on the PS3 stage's malfunction after launch.

Palak paneer row leads to Rs 1.8-crore win for 2 Indians against US universityIndian PhD students Aditya Prakash and Urmi Bhattacheryya also argued that departmental kitchen rules at the University of Colorado Boulder singled out South Asians, discouraging community members from opening their lunches in common areas.

Robot surgeons in 3 years? Musk's 'pointless' medical school claim misses a big truthElon Musk has claimed that medical degrees will soon be pointless as AI-powered robots outperform human surgeons. While robotic surgery is advancing rapidly, experts warn that medicine cannot function without human judgement, accountability and ethical responsibility. The debate raises critical questions about who controls, manages and answers for machines in healthcare.

What is flash fog? The science behind Delhi's blink-and-you-miss-it fogThis wasn't your standard all-night fog. What Delhi-NCR experienced was a short-lived but intense phenomenon often referred to as rapid-onset or flash fog.

India plans rocket-missile force with eye on Pak. What it can learn from IranThe Army chief has said India is raising a rocket-cum-missile force, especially because both China and Pakistan have a dedicated unit on similar lines. However, India should look to Iran, which arguably has the world's largest and most potent missile force.

What H-1B visa-holders can expect in 2026 and who stands to lose mostAfter a chaotic 2025, the new year is shaping up to be an uncertain one for H-1B visa-holders and applicants. New US rules, including higher fees, wage-based lotteries and tougher background checks, under President Trump could further restrict visas unless American courts step in to block them.

Your coffee tastes better today, thanks to one woman's experimentMelitta Bentz invented the paper coffee filter in her kitchen, revolutionising filtration methods. Her discovery highlights the overlooked impact of women's domestic innovations on global health.

Firings and layoffs at TCS: Over 30,000 gone in 6 months, full story in 5 pointsAccording to quarterly reports, TCS has let go of nearly 30,000 employees in just six months as part of sweeping restructuring drive. With more exit possible and stricter workplace policies in place, the shake-up is pointing to how the Indian tech biggie is preparing for the AI-driven future.

Enabling Indian takeover: Top US companies facing attacks for hiring IndiansAmerican employers hiring Indian professionals are now on the firing line of right-wing commentators on social media. A Financial Times report found that US companies were being accused of trying to replace American workers with Indian counterparts.

What is Trump's staircase model that's delaying India-US trade deal?The Trump administration's deal-making operates less like traditional diplomacy and more like a business sprint. Countries are rewarded for a speedy decision and penalised for delay. A missed deadline might have cost India an early advantage in trade talks, according to Trump aide Howard Lutnick. Here's all about the 'staircase' approach.

sports.headline: KL Rahul is India's crisis man, like Rahul Dravid once was: Sunil Gavaskar IND vs NZ: Sunil Gavaskar has hailed KL Rahul as India's modern-day ODI crisis man after his unbeaten 112 in Rajkot. The comparison with Rahul Dravid underlines Rahul's growing importance at No. 5.

PV Sindhu finds no issues with India Open conditions amid hygiene claims India's star badminton player PV Sindhu said that she found the playing conditions at the Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium to be fine amid the hygiene row surrounding the India Open. The conditions in Delhi was questioned by Anders Antonsen and Mia Blichfeldt.

DC vs UPW Live Score: Litchfield, Lanning stead Warriorz after Navgire departs Delhi Capitals Women (MI) vs UP Warriorz Women (GG) Live Score: Phoebe Litchfield and skipper Meg Lanning have steadied the Warriorz' innings after Marizanne Kapp took the wicket of the dangerous Kiran Navgire.

Delhi Air 'Not Safe': Danish Shuttler Pulls Out Of India Open Citing Delhi's 'Poisonous' Air This news bulletin addresses the alarming levels of air pollution in Delhi and its impact on international sporting events. A prominent Danish badminton player has withdrawn from the India Open, citing hazardous air quality in the national capital. The speaker notes that the athlete's decision was not based on injury or scheduling but on the fact that the 'air in the national capital is simply not safe.' The programme highlights the embarrassment of a global sporting event being deemed unfit for athletes due to breathing risks. The shuttler reportedly stated that Delhi is 'not the place to host tournaments under such conditions,' a comment the speaker describes as an indictment of years of apathy and inaction. The report concludes by calling the situation a national shame, as the city's air turns poisonous every winter, posing a daily risk to residents and now deterring international competitors.

Saw KL Rahul's hundred celebration in Rajkot ODI? Here's what it means KL Rahul scored a brilliant hundred for India after his return to the No.5 spot and decided to repeat his special celebration for his daughter during the Rajkot ODI on Wednesday, January 14.

KL Rahul hits 87-ball 100 in Rajkot. Should Gautam Gambhir give him No. 5 spot? KL Rahul's unbeaten 112 in Rajkot has reignited the No. 5 debate in India's ODI setup. With consistent returns in that role, Rahul is making a compelling case to be locked in there.

ISL roadmap inspired by LaLiga, Premier League, Bundesliga: AIFF chief seeks trust Under-fire AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey has unveiled a 21-year roadmap inspired by Europe's elite leagues. The plan promises structured governance for the ISL and I-League as Indian football searches for stability amid ongoing administrative chaos.

Ahead of T20 World Cup 2026, Australia to tour Pakistan for three-match series Pakistan and Australia will face off in a three-match T20I series at Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore, starting January 29, 2026. Both teams are using the series as their final preparation for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, with injuries impacting key players from each side.

PV Sindhu disappoints, 17-year-old Tanvi goes down fighting against World No. 2 India Open 2026: 12th-ranked PV Sindhu lost to familiar foe Nguyen Thuy Linh of Vietnam despite winning the opening game of their women's singles first-round match. Meanwhile, 17-year-old Tanvi Sharma stretched World No. 2 Wang Zhi Yi to three games in her debut at the Super 750 tournament.

Wahab Riaz named as Pakistan women's team mentor after World Cup debacle Wahab Riaz has been appointed as mentor for the Pakistan women's cricket team for their upcoming white-ball tour of South Africa, with the appointment confirmed by the Pakistan Cricket Board. The tour, set to begin February 10, marks the team's first series since finishing last at the ICC Women's World Cup, and includes new faces as well as key recalls in both T20I and ODI squads.

Virat Kohli returns to No. 1 spot after 4 years, Rohit Sharma drops to thirdICC ODI Rankings: Virat Kohli returned to the No. 1 spot in the ODI batting charts for the first time in four years. He rose to the top spot after a sensational run in the 50-over format since his return to competitive action in October.

Rajkot ODI: No debut for Ayush Badoni as India pick Washington Sundar replacementIndia vs New Zealand, 2nd ODI: India picked fast-bowling all-rounder Niitsh Kumar Reddy as Washington Sundar's replacement for the second ODI in Rajkot on Wednesday. Ayush Badoni, who was handed his maiden call-up, will have to wait for his first chance to play for the senior national team.

Josh Hazlewood confident of T20 World Cup 2026 return after injury setbacksAustralia pacer Josh Hazlewood is confident of being fit for the T20 World Cup in Sri Lanka next month after an injury-hit summer, with the fast bowler targeting a warm-up game ahead of Australia's opening match on February 11.

India Open: After hygiene row, World No. 2 says polluted Delhi unfit for badmintonWorld No. 2 Anders Antonsen revealed why he was not a part of the India Open in Delhi, citing extreme air pollution as the reason, raising fresh concerns over player safety and tournament conditions. His statement came a day after his compatriot Mia Blichfeldt called out unhygienic training conditions in New Delhi.

Kohli's conversion rate puts him ahead of Rohit Sharma in ODIs: Former batterMohammad Kaif praises Virat Kohli's impressive conversion rate in ODI cricket, saying it puts him ahead of Rohit Sharma in ODI cricket. Kohli scored 93 (91) in the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara.

Ayush Badoni's ODI selection unfair: Kris Srikkanth alleges favouritism in explosive takeIND vs NZ: Former selector Kris Srikkanth has slammed Ayush Badoni's ODI selection as unfair, questioning the yardstick used by selectors and alleging favouritism after consistent performers were overlooked.

WPL 2026: Meg Lanning set for emotional reunion as Capitals, Warriorz seek redemptionWPL 2026, DC vs UPW: Meg Lanning is all set for an emotional reunion with the Delhi Capitals as UP Warriorz look to bounce back following back-to-back defeats in the competition.

Multiple injuries ring alarm bells for India's T20 World Cup title defence at homeIndia's preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026 face hurdles due to injuries to key players namely Tilak Varma and Washington Sundar. The unforeseen injuries have hampered India's preparedness ahead of their title defence at home.

Tennis player forgets tie-break rules, celebrates early and suffers crushing lossSebastian Ofner's early celebration backfired in stunning fashion as Nishesh Basavareddy staged a dramatic comeback to win a chaotic Australian Open qualifier tiebreak 13–11.

Grace Hayden on her dad's gamble on Joe Root, India connection and foray into tennisGrace Hayden talks about her father Matthew Hayden's risky Joe Root bet, the overwhelming love she receives from Indian fans, and why she's excited to step beyond cricket and into the world of tennis broadcasting.

Fit and fierce PV Sindhu targets World Championships, Asian Games in 2026India's star shuttler PV Sindhu has returned to full fitness. Sindhu made a tremendous return to Malaysia Masters, the first competition of the season, and is now ready for a long series which includes the World Championships and Asian Games.

T20 World Cup: Visas denied to Pakistan-origin USA players? Here's the truthPakistani-origin USA players are facing visa delays ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 hosted by India and Sri Lanka. However, there have been widespread reports claiming their visas have been denied.

Henry Nicholls backs inexperienced New Zealand side to bounce back in RajkotNew Zealand batter Henry Nicholls has backed their inexperienced side to bounce back in the second ODI against India in Rajkot. The Kiwis lost the first match by four wickets and are trailing by 0-1 in three-match series.

Confident India target ODI series win in Rajkot despite injury concernsThe Indian side will look to seal yet another white-ball series and avoid further injury concerns when they take on New Zealand in the second ODI at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Wednesday.

India to revise ODI batting template after T20 World Cup: Batting coachIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said the team would need to revise its ODI batting template after the T20 World Cup in March, especially in light of the new rule that brings in a second ball after the 34th over. As per the change in playing conditions, bowling teams have to pick any one of the two balls to continue bowling from overs 35-50.

MI vs GG: Harmanpreet Kaur becomes first Indian to reach 1000 runs in WPL historyHarmanpreet Kaur became the first Indian cricketer to cross the 1,000-run mark in the Women's Premier League, producing a commanding knock to lead the Mumbai Indians to yet another victory over the Gujarat Giants.

Harmanpreet Kaur haunts Gujarat again as Mumbai Indians make it 8-0 against GiantsWPL 2026, MI vs GG: Harmanpreet Kaur scored an unbeaten 71 as Mumbai Indians beat the Gujarat Giants by seven wickets on Tuesday after chasing down 193 with four balls to spare at the DY Patil Stadium.

Pakistan-born USA pacer claims India visa denied ahead of T20 World Cup: ReportUSA fast bowler Ali Khan has claimed his Indian visa application has been denied less than a month before the ICC Men's T20 World Cup begins, adding a fresh layer of uncertainty to the Americans' preparations for the tournament.

Arbeloa reveals Alonso wished him well after he became Real Madrid's new managerÁlvaro Arbeloa said Xabi Alonso reached out to wish him well after his appointment as Real Madrid manager, underlining that their friendship remains strong despite their new roles.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
